amendment.description: Amendment affirms that ISPs can still block unlawful content, such as child pornography or copyright-infringing materials.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 12 printed in Part A of House Report 116-37 to affirm that ISPs can still block unlawful content, such as child pornography or copyright-infringing materials.

vote.text: On agreeing to the McAdams amendment (A012) Agreed to by recorded vote: 423 - 0 (Roll no. 165).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A012) offered by Mr. McAdams.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the McAdams amendment (A012) Agreed to by recorded vote: 423 - 0 (Roll no. 165).
